review_title: Appreciated the work-environment better once I left
pros:
Collective effort
Good management
Learning environment
Autonomy
Freedom inside the PT unit
cons:
Inter-professional power struggles
Doctor's attempts to belittle physios and give them the respect they deserve
Overall value given to a physiotherapist is lower than ideal

pros: Huge infrastructure with Good teaching faculties

Good doctors canteen
Good equipment
Toilets are kept clean
Next to a black river
Road is good
cons: Cheaters, backstabbers, barbarians and only know to play dirty filthy politics with doctors. The nurses and allied staff are their spies and they dictate things to doctors.  They use you and throw you like napkins. No kindness and empathy. HR department is only a rubber stamp.a bunch of morons roam around in ties. Their only productivity is doctor bashing. This is a good place for butchers and barber's.

pros:
Will be able to handle all sorts of Biomedical Eqpt. 
Will be able to learn about all the equipment in the hospital. 
Good training regimen.
Seniors are very helpful.
cons:
Bad management and Dept Head
Low Salary Package.
Almost no benefits.

pros:
Well oriented working environment Kerala.
A corporate feel with good cooperation among employees.
cons:
Duty schedule very difficult to cope up.
As a hospital service sector pressure on employees is more.

job_title: Staff Nurse Grade I in Mumbai
pros: It is a full fledged super speciality hospital with most modern facilities
cons: Travelling was very difficult as I was staying away from the place.

pros: Consultants are top notch. Bustling place. Great environment. Systematic protocols.
cons: The pay is on the lower end of the spectrum
Worst and poor management i have ever seen ... Treat employees like a slave , specially accounts department . Beware Patients and bystanders who visits insurance department ( specially ESIC)

pros: Good things are there to say
cons: Nothing to be mentioned as cons
